attributes.name: Colonial Period
attributes.description: Period of American colonization by European powers, primarily Great Britain

attributes.name: American Revolution
attributes.description: War for independence from Great Britain

attributes.name: Early Republic
attributes.description: Formation and early development of the United States government

attributes.name: Antebellum Era
attributes.description: Period of growth and division leading to the Civil War

attributes.name: Civil War
attributes.description: War between the Union and Confederate states

attributes.name: Reconstruction
attributes.description: Post-Civil War rebuilding and integration of Southern states

attributes.name: Gilded Age
attributes.description: Era of rapid economic growth, industrialization, and wealth inequality

attributes.name: Progressive Era
attributes.description: Period of social activism and political reform

attributes.name: Roaring Twenties
attributes.description: Period of economic prosperity and cultural dynamism

attributes.name: Great Depression
attributes.description: Severe economic downturn causing high unemployment and economic hardship

attributes.name: World War II
attributes.description: American involvement in the global conflict

attributes.name: Cold War
attributes.description: Geopolitical tension between the United States and Soviet Union

attributes.name: Civil Rights Movement
attributes.description: Movement for racial equality and ending discrimination

attributes.name: Modern Era
attributes.description: Post-Cold War period to present day

attributes.name: Founding of Jamestown
attributes.description: First permanent English settlement in North America
attributes.significance: Established English presence in North America

attributes.name: Plymouth Colony Established
attributes.description: Pilgrims establish Plymouth Colony after arriving on the Mayflower
attributes.significance: Early religious settlement that shaped New England culture

attributes.name: Declaration of Independence
attributes.description: Formal declaration of independence from Great Britain
attributes.significance: Foundational document establishing American independence

attributes.name: Constitutional Convention
attributes.description: Convention to create a new constitution for the United States
attributes.significance: Created the United States Constitution

attributes.name: Louisiana Purchase
attributes.description: Purchase of the Louisiana Territory from France
attributes.significance: Doubled the size of the United States

attributes.name: Civil War Begins
attributes.description: Confederate forces attack Fort Sumter, beginning the Civil War
attributes.significance: Started the bloodiest conflict in American history

attributes.name: Emancipation Proclamation
attributes.description: Lincoln declares slaves in Confederate states to be free
attributes.significance: Changed the character of the Civil War and began the process of ending slavery

attributes.name: Civil War Ends
attributes.description: General Lee surrenders to General Grant, effectively ending the Civil War
attributes.significance: Ended the Civil War and preserved the Union

attributes.name: 19th Amendment
attributes.description: Constitutional amendment giving women the right to vote
attributes.significance: Major achievement for women's rights and democracy

attributes.name: Stock Market Crash
attributes.description: Stock market crashes, triggering the Great Depression
attributes.significance: Led to the worst economic crisis in American history

attributes.name: Attack on Pearl Harbor
attributes.description: Japanese forces attack the US Naval base at Pearl Harbor
attributes.significance: Brought the United States into World War II

attributes.name: I Have a Dream Speech
attributes.description: Martin Luther King Jr. delivers his famous speech during the March on Washington
attributes.significance: Defining moment in the Civil Rights Movement

attributes.name: Moon Landing
attributes.description: NASA's Apollo 11 mission lands humans on the Moon
attributes.significance: Major achievement in space exploration and technology

attributes.name: September 11 Attacks
attributes.description: Terrorist attacks using hijacked airplanes
attributes.significance: Deadliest terrorist attack in history, led to major changes in US foreign policy

attributes.name: Barack Obama Elected President
attributes.description: Barack Obama elected as first African American president of the United States
attributes.significance: Historic milestone in American race relations and politics

attributes.name: George Washington
attributes.significance: Led Continental Army, first US President, established presidential precedents

attributes.name: Thomas Jefferson
attributes.significance: Authored Declaration of Independence, expanded US territory, founded University of Virginia

attributes.name: Abraham Lincoln
attributes.significance: Preserved the Union during Civil War, emancipated slaves, modernized economy

attributes.name: Frederick Douglass
attributes.significance: Escaped slave who became leading abolitionist and advocate for equality

attributes.name: Franklin D. Roosevelt
attributes.significance: Led US through Great Depression and most of World War II, established New Deal programs

attributes.name: Martin Luther King Jr.
attributes.significance: Led nonviolent civil rights movement, advocated for racial equality

attributes.name: Democracy
attributes.description: System of government by the people, typically through elected representatives

attributes.name: Slavery
attributes.description: System of forced labor where people are owned as property

attributes.name: Manifest Destiny
attributes.description: Belief that American settlers were destined to expand across North America

attributes.name: Civil Rights
attributes.description: Rights to personal liberty and equality under the law

attributes.name: American Dream
attributes.description: Belief that anyone can achieve success and prosperity through hard work

attributes.name: Declaration of Independence
attributes.description: Document declaring the thirteen American colonies as independent sovereign states
attributes.significance: Foundational document of the United States

attributes.name: United States Constitution
attributes.description: Supreme law of the United States establishing the structure of the federal government
attributes.significance: Foundational legal document of the United States

attributes.name: Gettysburg Address
attributes.description: Speech given by President Lincoln during the Civil War
attributes.significance: Redefined the purpose of the Civil War and American democracy

attributes.significance: Start of the Constitutional government of the United States

attributes.description: Election of Abraham Lincoln
attributes.significance: Event that triggered secession of Southern states

attributes.description: Civil Rights Act of 1964
attributes.significance: Landmark civil rights legislation

attributes.description: Dissolution of the Soviet Union
attributes.significance: End of the Cold War and beginning of a new geopolitical era

attributes.name: Ideological Positions
attributes.description: Ideological positions and political philosophies

attributes.name: Social Values
attributes.description: Social and cultural values across time

attributes.name: Founding Principles
attributes.description: Cluster representing founding principles of American democracy

attributes.name: Civil Rights Movement
attributes.description: Cluster representing civil rights movement principles

attributes.name: Economic Development
attributes.description: Cluster representing economic development principles

attributes.name: Democracy and Civil Rights Relationship
attributes.interpretation: Strong conceptual link between democratic governance and civil rights

attributes.name: Liberty and American Dream Relationship
attributes.interpretation: American founding principles closely aligned with aspirational values

attributes.name: Evolution of Democracy
attributes.interpretation: Significant expansion of democratic concepts to include broader participation

attributes.name: Evolution of Equality
attributes.interpretation: Major transformation in understanding of equality across demographic groups
